1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (18:02): html5.enable isn't in the shipping 3.5, right?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:02): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: right
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (18:03): 7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b: Yeah, you're missing out.  I'm pretty sure I'm physically addicted to 44oz double-vanilla Dr. Peppers.
7cbd522d7fcf593a1e60d52c789b6a7b (18:05): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: every now and then i get a fix when i go back to my parents home in oklahoma... ;)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: There's a bug in html5 enabled Fx giving the wrong tree through DOM unless there's an alert first
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:15): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: test case?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:15): was expecting that
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:16): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: with which parser?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:16): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: HTML 5
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:16): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: known issue in the old one
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:16): This particular bug doesn't exist in the old one as far as I can tell
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:16): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: does it involve object, applet, video or the like?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:16): No
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:17): interesting
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:17): Just the last node in the document being a text node
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:17): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: oh do you mean you can't see document.written trailing text via DOM?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:18): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: yeah
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:18): Yeah, it is only document.written text
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:18): only just found that out
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:18): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: an alert shouldn't help with that
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:18): but yeah, known issue
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:18): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Got a bug for that?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:18): basically, I aligned with WebKit
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:18): than Hixie said aligment with IE was right
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:19): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I think there's no bug. I'll file one
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:19): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Opera has the same bug/design, IIRC
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:20): We match HTML 5 as far as I can tell
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:20): http://html5.org/parsing-tests/testrunner.htm fails a lot in Fx because of it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:21): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Why does it depend upon the presence of an alert though?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:21): https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=511405 filed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:21): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: it shouldn't!
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:21): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: that's very odd
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:22): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Using an alert seems to flush the buffer
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:22): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Also, shouldn't document.close() flush it?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:23): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: yes.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:23): Hmm, my minimal TC is too minimal :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:23): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: ooh. you use document.close!
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:23): it doesn't flush synchronously
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:23): s/you/zcorpan/ :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:23): alert spins the event loop, so it gets flushed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:24): alert doesn't affect document.write AFAIK but does affect document.close
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:24): You got any got idea of how to fix that script?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:24): (or should it just be fixed in fx?)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:25): document.write a comment after the text
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:25): it'll take a while before I get to fixing it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:25): Then magic is needed to avoid that causing all tests to fail
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:26): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Can't you use a data url rather than document.write, or something?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:26): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: can you use setTimeout for the continuation ofter document.close?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:26): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: it fails in WebKit, too, right?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:27): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: Weird stuff happens in WebKit with that script :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:27): Like throwing when writing <script><div><script> into the iframe in the specific case, but not when doing it outside of that script
